intro: Lacinaria scariosa var. spheroidea, commonly known as the globe lichen, is a unique species characterized by its spherical or globular thallus structure. It belongs to the family Lecanoraceae and is a foliose lichen, meaning it has a leaf-like appearance with distinct upper and lower surfaces. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae and fungi, which provide essential nutrients for survival. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on bark or soil surfaces in temperate regions. Its distinctive shape and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
